preface.title: A Shell for the Web...
preface.para: IOVAR begins as a collection of web utilities on a Java foundation. It continues by providing a web-aware shell environment and scripting language. Common patterns, protocols, and schemas are embraced to provide familiar environments for the user and wider opportunity for automation.

section.title: 1.1 Release Imminent
section.para: New features and changes in this release include:

listitem.para: Sources and releases available on GitHub
JAR executable bit with the .ioexec extension

section.title: Migration from iovar.win to iovar.net
section.para: The more easily-recognizable iovar.net domain name has now been chosen for all official IOVAR developments and releases, and abandon the old website at iovar.win. Any references to the old domain or package namespace must be updated.

blockquote.para: I am happy to share the IOVAR system in the hopes that others may find it useful.

What began many years ago as a means to work with XML on the web has blossomed into a fully-featured development platform. It has been my passion to explore new ways of programming while also embracing with fresh eyes the existing tried-and-true methods. Although I am embarrassed to say that IOVAR still has a number of bugs and remains woefully incomplete for its intended purpose, I also recognize that in software, much like life itself, perfection is impossible.
